title: (x) Typewriter font in "Vitamin D - new perspectives in drawing" - Everson Mono {Florian}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821130833im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/type1_3884.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821130833im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/type2_6492.jpg)

I couldn’t ID it on identifont. Any ideas?

 [‹ (x) Chunky, filled-in, stencil - Kada {Simon H}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821130833/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39196 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bitmap font used in www.seriph.com website - miniml standard 07\_55 {Thomas Ryuk} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821130833/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39303 "Go to next forum topic")
author: frode frank

comments.content: That is a GREAT book but I don’t know the font, sorry.

We had [this recently](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821130833/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38400): it’s a customized version of [Everson Mono](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821130833/http:/www.evertype.com/emono/).
forgive me. I just read the “read before you post”-post, but my eyes must have skipped that. the book is totally wonderful btw. but oh so expencive for a young man.

Det gjør ingenting …

<cite>but oh so expencive</cite>  
No good libraries in town? ;°)

Danke schøn.

That’s improvised though. Yours is perfect norwegian.
